['bib']abstract: In the recent past, Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) has become very popular as it allows legacy systems to remain mostly unchanged and provide functionalities in the form of services. In contrast to traditional software application development, complexity of SOA application is much higher, making the effort estimation very difficult. ['bib']author: Siddiqui, Zeeshan Ali and Tyagi, Kirti

['bib']abstract: Determining size and effort of SOA systems is critical for managing SOA projects. ['bib']abstract: In COCOMO II, the primary input for estimating development effort in person month (PM), duration, and cost is the size of the software. Until now, there are two ways to get the size, namely (1) size is estimated using a line of code of software, and (2) size is estimated using unadjusted function points (UFP), which is one of the functional size measurements (FSM). ['bib']abstract: ISO 14143-1 specifies that a functional size measurement (FSM) method must provide measurement procedures to quantify the functional user requirements (FURs) of software. ['bib']abstract: Literature review shows that more accurate software effort and cost estimation methods are needed for software project management success.
